Package NumberConverterSystem.Controllers

Class QuizController

java.lang.Object
NumberConverterSystem.Controllers.QuizController
public class QuizController extends Object
The QuizController class provides static methods for managing and conducting interactive quizzes related to number base conversions. It generates random questions, collects user input, verifies answers, and tracks the user's score.

This controller is intended for use in command-line environments, allowing users to test and improve their understanding of number base conversions. It supports automatic question generation with random values and bases, and provides immediate feedback on user responses.

Features:

  • Configurable number of quiz questions per session.
  • Random generation of quiz questions, including value, source base, and target base.
  • Interactive user input collection via standard input.
  • Answer verification and feedback for each question.
  • Score tracking and summary at the end of the quiz.

Usage Example: 

 // Start a quiz session
 QuizController.startQuiz();

Since:
2025-08-26

  • Field Details

    • NUMBER_OF_QUESTIONS

      public static int NUMBER_OF_QUESTIONS
      The number of questions to be asked in each quiz session.

      This value can be modified to change the length of the quiz. Default is 5.

    • random

      public static Random random
      A shared Random instance used for generating random values and bases for quiz questions.

    • scanner

      public static Scanner scanner
      A shared Scanner instance used for reading user input from the standard input stream.

  • Constructor Details

    • QuizController

      public QuizController()

  • Method Details

    • startQuiz

      public static void startQuiz()
      Starts an interactive quiz session for the user.

      The quiz consists of NUMBER_OF_QUESTIONS randomly generated questions. For each question, the user is presented with a value, source base, and target base, and is prompted to enter the converted value. The user's answer is verified, and feedback is provided immediately. The user's score is tracked and displayed at the end.

      Quiz Flow:

      1. For each question:
        • Generate a random QuizQuestion.
        • Display the value, source base, and target base to the user.
        • Prompt the user for their answer.
        • Verify the answer using QuizQuestion.verifyAnswer(String).
        • Provide feedback: indicate if the answer was correct or display the correct answer.
      2. After all questions, display the user's total score.

      Example Output: 

        Value : 101 - Source Base : 2 - Target Base : 10
  [User enters answer]
  The Answer was correct
  ...
  Your Score out of 5 was 4

    • generateQuestion

      public static QuizQuestion generateQuestion()
      Generates a random QuizQuestion for the quiz.

      The method randomly selects:

      • A source base between 2 and 36 (inclusive).
      • A target base between 2 and 36 (inclusive).
      • An integer value between 10 and 999 (inclusive), which is then converted to the source base.
      The correct answer is computed by converting the value from the source base to the target base using ConverterController.convertIntegerToTargetBase(String, int, int). The resulting QuizQuestion contains the value (in source base), the correct answer, the source base, and the target base.

      Example: 

         sourceBase = 16
   targetBase = 2
   valueBase10 = 255
   value = "ff" (in base 16)
   answer = "11111111" (in base 2)

      Returns:
      A randomly generated QuizQuestion containing the value, correct answer, source base, and target base.
